hints.label: thm-complete-variance-drift
hints.title: Complete Variance Drift Characterization for Cloning
hints.content:
6942: :label: thm-complete-variance-drift
6943: 
6944: The cloning operator $\Psi_{\text{clone}}$ induces the following drift on the variance components of the Lyapunov function:
6945: 
6946: **1. Positional Variance (Strong Contraction):**
6947: 
6948: $$
6949: \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_{\text{Var},x}] \leq -\kappa_x V_{\text{Var},x} + C_x
6950: $$
6951: 
6952: where $\kappa_x > 0$ is $N$-independent (from Keystone Principle).
6953: 
6954: **2. Velocity Variance (Bounded Expansion):**
6955: 
6956: $$
6957: \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_{\text{Var},v}] \leq C_v
6958: $$
6959: 
6960: where $C_v < \infty$ is a state-independent constant.
6961: 
6962: **3. Total Internal Variance:**
6963: 
6964: $$
6965: \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_{\text{Var}}] = \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_{\text{Var},x}] + \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_{\text{Var},v}] \leq -\kappa_x V_{\text{Var},x} + (C_x + C_v)
6966: $$

hints.label: proof-thm-complete-variance-drift
hints.content:
6971: :::{prf:proof}
6972: :label: proof-thm-complete-variance-drift
6973: **Proof.**
6974: 
6975: This result follows immediately by combining the two component drift inequalities established earlier in this chapter.
6976: 
6977: From {prf:ref}`thm-positional-variance-contraction` ({prf:ref}`thm-positional-variance-contraction`), we have:
6978: 
6979: $$
6980: \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_{\text{Var},x}] \leq -\kappa_x V_{\text{Var},x} + C_x
6981: $$
6982: 
6983: From {prf:ref}`thm-bounded-velocity-expansion-cloning` ({prf:ref}`thm-velocity-variance-bounded-expansion`), we have:
6984: 
6985: $$
6986: \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_{\text{Var},v}] \leq C_v
6987: $$
6988: 
6989: By linearity of expectation, the total internal variance drift is:
6990: 
6991: $$
6992: \begin{aligned}
6993: \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_{\text{Var}}] &= \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_{\text{Var},x} + \Delta V_{\text{Var},v}] \\
6994: &= \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_{\text{Var},x}] + \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_{\text{Var},v}] \\
6995: &\leq (-\kappa_x V_{\text{Var},x} + C_x) + C_v \\
6996: &= -\kappa_x V_{\text{Var},x} + (C_x + C_v)
6997: \end{aligned}
6998: $$
6999: 
7000: This establishes the claimed drift inequality for the total variance.

hints.label: rem-drift-constants-dependencies
hints.title: Constants and Parameter Dependencies
hints.content:
7028: :label: rem-drift-constants-dependencies
7029: 
7030: The drift constants have the following dependencies:
7031: 
7032: **Contraction rate $\kappa_x$:**
7033: - Increases with measurement quality (larger $\epsilon$ → better diversity detection)
7034: - Increases with cloning responsiveness (larger $p_{\max}$ and smaller $\varepsilon_{\text{clone}}$)
7035: - Independent of $N$ (N-uniformity from Keystone)
7036: 
7037: **Expansion bound $C_v$:**
7038: - Increases with $V_{\max}^2$ (larger velocity domain)
7039: - Increases with $\alpha_{\text{restitution}}$ (more elastic collisions)
7040: - Decreases toward zero as $\alpha_{\text{restitution}} \to 0$ (perfectly inelastic)
7041: - Independent of $N$
